name: 邱家吉
objective: This course focus on investigating the strength and deformability of jointed rock mass from analyzing the mechanical behavior of intact rock and discontinuities. Related issues for rock engineering such as numerical analysis, in-situ stress, rock hydraulics, and rock classification will be introduced, to help students understand the theory and the application of rock mechanics.
schedule:
Week 1 Introduction
Week 2 Stress and strain basics in rock mechanics
Week 3 Field investigation techniques, Rock classifications, Stereo projection
Week 4 Properties of intact rock
Week 5 (10/10 holiday break)
Week 6 (10/17 conference break)
Week 7 Properties of intact rock
Week 8 Discontinuities in rock
Week 9 Discontinuities in rock
Week 10 Midterm exam 
Week 11 Behavior of jointed rock masses
Week 12 In-situ stress 
Week 13 Rock hydraulics
Week 14 Rock slope stability
Week 15 Tunnel and rock masses excavation
Week 16 Tunnel and rock masses excavation
Week 17 Numerical analysis in rock mechanics
Week 18 Final exam
scorePolicy: Midterm exam (30%), Final exam (30%), Homework (30%), attendance (10%)
materials:
1. Goodman R.E. (1989), Introduction to Rock Mechanics
2. Hoek, E. and Brown, E.T. (1981), Underground Excavations in Rock
3. Hoek, E. and Bray J. W. (1996), Rock Slope Engineering
